revised_title: Experimental Researches in Voltaic Electricity: Challenges to Volta's Theory
tldr: The author, William Ritchie, presents experimental evidence to challenge Volta's theory of galvanic circles and electricity. He demonstrates that contact of dissimilar metals is not necessary for producing galvanic action and that voltaic and common electricity have distinct differences. Ritchie also investigates the fundamental principles and laws of action of the voltaic battery, finding that voltaic energies are proportional to the square root of the number of plates within certain limits.
